org.knime.core.node.port.database

Class DatabaseUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.knime.core.node.port.database.DatabaseUtility
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DB2Utility, MySQLUtility, OracleUtility, PostgreSQLUtility, SQLiteUtility, SQLServerUtility

    public class DatabaseUtility
extends Object
    This class is the entry point for database specific routines and information. All implementations must be thread-safe.
    Since:
    2.10
    Author:
    Thorsten Meinl, KNIME.com, Zurich, Switzerland, Tobias Koetter, KNIME.com, Zurich, Switzerland

      Default database utility identifier.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DatabaseUtility

        @Deprecated
public DatabaseUtility()
        Deprecated. 
        Constructor that uses all default aggregation methods.
        See Also:
        DatabaseUtility(String, StatementManipulator, DBAggregationFunctionFactory...)

      • DatabaseUtility

        public DatabaseUtility(String dbIdentifier,
                       StatementManipulator stmtManipulator,
                       DBAggregationFunctionFactory... aggregationFunctions)
        Parameters:
        dbIdentifier - the unique database identifier or null to use default
        stmtManipulator - the StatementManipulator or null to use default
        aggregationFunctions - array of all DBAggregationFunctions or null to use default
        Since:
        2.11

    • Method Detail

      • getUtility

        public static DatabaseUtility getUtility(String dbIdentifier)
        Returns a utility implementation for the given database type. If no specific implementation is available, a generic manipulator is returned.
        Parameters:
        dbIdentifier - the database identifier, usually the second part of a JDBC URL (getDatabaseIdentifier(); must not be null
        Returns:
        an SQL manipulator

      • getDatabaseIdentifiers

        public static Collection<String> getDatabaseIdentifiers()
        Returns:
        Collection of database identifiers of all registered database utility implementations
        Since:
        2.11

      • getDatabaseIdentifier

        public String getDatabaseIdentifier()
        Returns:
        the identifier of the db usually the second part of the jdbc url
        Since:
        2.11

      • getStatementManipulator

        public StatementManipulator getStatementManipulator()
        Returns a statement manipulator for the database.
        Returns:
        a statement manipulator

      • getAggregationFunctions

        public Collection<DBAggregationFunction> getAggregationFunctions()
        Returns a list if all aggregation functions that the current database supports.
        Returns:
        Collection of all supported DBAggregationFunctions
        Since:
        2.11

      • getAggregationFunction

        public DBAggregationFunction getAggregationFunction(String id)
        Returns the aggregation function with the given id, if the current database supports it. Otherwise a InvalidDBAggregationFunction is returned.
        Parameters:
        id - the id as returned by AggregationFunction.getId()
        Returns:
        the DBAggregationFunction for the given name or an instance of the InvalidDBAggregationFunction that has the given id
        Since:
        2.11

      • supportsInsert

        public boolean supportsInsert()
        Returns whether the database supports INSERT operations. The default is true.
        Returns:
        true if INSERT is supported, false otherwise

      • supportsUpdate

        public boolean supportsUpdate()
        Returns whether the database supports UPDATE operations. The default is true.
        Returns:
        true if UPDATE is supported, false otherwise

      • supportsDelete

        public boolean supportsDelete()
        Returns whether the database supports DELETE operations. The default is true.
        Returns:
        true if DELETE is supported, false otherwise

      • supportsRandomSampling

        public boolean supportsRandomSampling()
        Returns:
        true if the database supports random sampling
        Since:
        3.1

      • supportsCase

        public boolean supportsCase()
        Returns:
        true if the database supports CASE statements
        Since:
        3.1

      • tableExists

        public boolean tableExists(Connection conn,
                           String tableName)
                    throws SQLException
        Returns whether the given table name exists in the database denoted by the connection.
        Parameters:
        conn - a database connection
        tableName - the table's name
        Returns:
        true if the table exists, false otherwise
        Throws:
        SQLException - if an DB error occurs
        Since:
        2.10

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid(Connection conn)
                throws SQLException
        Checks if the given connection is valid and can be re-used. If the database driver does not support Connection.isValid(int) then a SELECT 1 statement is issued instead.
        Parameters:
        conn - any connection
        Returns:
        true if the connection is valid
        Throws:
        SQLException - if an SQL error occurs
        Since:
        2.12

      • getReader

        public DBReader getReader(DatabaseQueryConnectionSettings querySettings)
        Parameters:
        querySettings - the DatabaseQueryConnectionSettings
        Returns:
        the DBReader to perform read operations in the db
        Since:
        3.1

      • getWriter

        public DBWriter getWriter(DatabaseConnectionSettings connSettings)
        Parameters:
        connSettings - DatabaseConnectionSettings
        Returns:
        DBWriter to use to write, update or delete values in this db
        Since:
        3.1
